website_summaries.verdict: The well-equipped ViewSonic XG2700-4K is a 27-inch gaming monitor that uses AMD's FreeSync anti-tearing technology and an In-Plane Switching (IPS) panel to deliver ultra-smooth gaming performance and rich, accurate colors.
pros: Very accurate color and grayscale performance

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to be of good quality but didn't like the 60hz
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't stand the 60hz when it was so close to my face, it was fine for watching videos where I'm a bit further away, but when playing games or simply moving the mouse across the screen the 60hz just wasn't smooth enough and gave me headaches within a few minutes. If I were to buy another 4k monitor I would look for something that had a refresh rate of at least 75hz or more. I'd probably go more just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ViewSonic not compatible with my HP!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy ViewSonic for a Hewlett Packard PC. I bought this 300 dollar VS monitor at the same time as an HP gaming PC for my son's birthday. We waited till his birthday to open the boxes and by the time we did VS's 7 day return window had passed. HP tried to repair the PC but could not as VS is not compatible. Amazon won't take it back because more than 30 days have passed after repair attempts, so we are stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: FRED BICKNESE

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Panel is very easy to navigate. Such a beautiful picture. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture. Only 1 HDMI port is 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. OSD is pretty straightforward. Only 1 HDMI port is 2.0, so if you want more than one 4k 60 Hz HDMI device at once look elsewhere. No auto input switching that I've been able to find. Looks to be a good stop-gap until good HDR becomes more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Maxagorn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Gaming monitor, my sons loves it. Quality and resolution is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: XG2700-4K 27 Inch 60Hz 4K Gaming Monitor
customer_reviews.text: It isn't fair for me to rate this item as I had to return it. This monitor was not compatible with my older model computer.
customer_reviews.author: Reva

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be sincere, i was terrified for all the reviews i readed about ips panels, ips glow, blb all that stuff, but let me tell you that this monitor is amazing, the workspace you gain , the color reproduction, everything, i could not be happier, the only thing that i recommend for someone who buy one and use it for the first time is to use the display port, looks better than Hdmi and to reduce the brightness, it is set to 100% from the box, it hurted my eyes, i use it in small office with low ambient light, once i got that fixed everything was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Returned for Dead pixels - Unacceptable in 2017
customer_reviews.text: A $550 monitor with dead pixels? Returned and good riddance. This is unacceptable given that this monitor is factory calibrated by a human being. So ViewSonic has the product calibrated but doesn't notice dead pixels? I think they are hoping that the customer won't notice. Either way, this is my first and last ViewSonic purchase in over 15 years. Their quality control is atrocious. I will stick with Dell as I've never had a problem with their monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer T.

customer_reviews.title: HUGE Problems w/ Color Balance, Light Balance, and Sharpness
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't like this monitor as much as I had anticipated to. The cons are definitely overwhelming, bad and aged menu that for some is impossible to navigate, the white isn't pure on this monitor and has a noticeable portion of yellow with it, the display is dim and is a struggle to look like an ACTUAL LED screen, the text is noticeably blurry and even with sharpness at 100%, it's still blurry. I think I honestly may just return this and find a better 4k monitor. Too many problems with this one regarding color and light balance.
customer_reviews.author: Calibur

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k Freesync monitor
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. The colors are vibrant, and the display can get very bright - much brighter than my old Dell 24-inch it replaced. Driving it with a R9 380, I was getting 40+ fps in WoW on ultra settings (no AA needed at 4k resolution), spiking up much higher in some areas. Minimum fps in cities hovered around 40. Freesync works great if you can keep games above 40 fps. Freesync range for this monitor is 40-60 fps. I wish the lower bound for freesync was lower, so I wouldn't notice tearing below 40, but I am not sure if that is the monitor's fault or AMD's. All the more reason to upgrade my graphics card!
customer_reviews.author: Weston W. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful image, great latency (or lack-of-latency)
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Beautiful image, great latency (or lack-of-latency), and quite light. Also, the quad view is a great internal feature. Con: Menu is hard to navigate...REALLY annoying!
customer_reviews.author: DC Productions

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you're strictly a console gamer this is not the monitor for you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice Monitor for everyday use and Gaming
customer_reviews.text: After having this monitor for awhile it real hard to go back to a 1920x1080. Nice and crisp picture. I don't play major framerate games but the ones I do play, this monitor rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Dubay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ps4,Xbox one gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: When I read the bad reviews on this monitor I thought maybe this was not one I wanted to buy,but when I looked deeper into the reviews I realized they were not reviewing the right monitor,all of the bad reviews were about a 24" monitor of a different manufacturer,this is my 2nd ViewSonic monitor and I am not disappointed,4K ips monitors don't go over 60 htz refresh rate so they are ideal for a ps4 or Xbox one despite what anyone says,I have a ben q monitor with 144 htz refresh rate but the console only supports 60 so it doesn't matter,my Ben q 2710 was my favorite monitor for a console until this one came out
customer_reviews.author: relichunter

product_meta.title: ViewSonic XG2700-4K 27 Inch 60Hz 4K Gaming Monitor with FreeSync Eye Care Advanced Ergonomics HDMI and DP
product_meta.description: Troubleshooting : No power • Make sure power button (or switch) is ON. • Make sure A/C power cord is securely connected to the display. • Plug another electrical device (like a radio) into the power outlet to verify that the outlet is supplying proper voltage. Power is ON but no screen image • Make sure the video cable supplied with the display is properly secured to the video output port on the back of the computer. If the other end of the video cable is not attached permanently to the display, properly secure it to the display. • Adjust brightness and contrast. • If you are using an Macintosh older than G3, you need a Macintosh adap Wrong or abnormal colors • If any colors (red, green, or blue) are missing, check the video cable to make sure it is securely connected. Loose or broken pins in the cable connector could cause an improper connection. • Connect the display to another computer. • If you have an older graphics card, contact ViewSonic for a non-DDC adapter. Control buttons do not work • Press only one button at a time.
